titleInfo.title: Brought to the Police Prison, First District.

mods.abstract: BROUGHT to the Police Prison, First District-- MARY HOGAN, a griffe, about fifty years old, five feet one inch high ; says she is free, but supposed to be a slave. LUCY, a griffe, about thirty-four years old, five feet six inches high, nail off forefinger of right hand ; says she belongs to Madam Johnson. JULIA, a black, about sixteen years old, five feet one-half inch high ; says she belongs to Madam Fortier. ANGELINA, a griffe, about twenty-one years old, four feet eleven and a half inches high ; says she belongs to Manuel Andry. The owners will please comply with the law respecting them. J. WORRALL, Warden. NewOrleans, August 21, 1852. au21 1aw3w
mods.note: Madam Johnson; Madam Fortier; Mr. Manuel Andry

detail.title: New Orleans daily crescent. ([New Orleans, La.]) 1851-1866

mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
